nodes.bodyText:
Hi.
Crash is on the rise in our production due to problems related to this issue.
When do you plan to be Merge?
It was confirmed that the v4 migration code was added on April 14. Our service version was up after that day, but errors started to appear that event_payloads already exists. What situations can event_payloads be already created?

@LeeOhHyung the situation arises if you have datatransport version 2.2.2 in you app, then downgrade to 2.2.1 and then back to 2.2.2.
The plan is to fix it asap.

Can you share what sequence of events lead to your crashes?
Did you go back and forth between versions of Firebase products ? Which ones?
What's the motivation for removing dropss?
We want the system to be lossless. Also, it seems impossible to completely clean the slate since we cannot look ahead in time.
I think is its safer to call a drop here before create table, this will make sure the created table matches the expected schema.

One of the goals was to have the system be lossless.
Are there a specific sequence of events that you can describe that would lead to faulty schemas?
I realize this is a mental exercise, but that's the only tool we have to reason about this.
Here's the PR that demonstrates the failures that we are currently prone to : #1548
It seems that most of these IF NOT EXISTS are redundant, the only place it matters is in event_payloads, also see my comment below regarding event_payloads.
